column4: At any time during the day, you may reveal yourself to the town as Mr Good (which will be host-confirmed). Henceforth, your vote will count for 3. // You may not join or be invited to any night chats once you have revealed yourself.
column5: At any time during the day, you may reveal yourself to the town as Mr Good (which will be host-confirmed). Henceforth, your vote will count for 3. // You may not join or be invited to any night chats once you have revealed yourself.

column4: Once per game, you can choose a dead player to revive. They die at the end of the next night.
column5: Once per game, you can choose a dead player to revive. They die at the end of the next night.

column4: Capture a player for the night and talk to them anonymously. // Twice per game, you may deal a strong attack to your jailed captive. // You may not capture the same player twice.
column5: Capture a player for the night and talk to them anonymously. // Twice per game, you may deal a strong attack to your jailed captive. // You may not capture the same player twice.

column4: Choose a player to bounce off. You bounce along their visit chain, visiting each player in turn, until the chain ends or repeats. Learn the alignment of the final player.
column5: Choose a player to bounce off. You bounce along their visit chain, visiting each player in turn, until the chain ends or repeats. Learn the alignment of the final player.

column4: Visit a player to investigate them, narrowing down their role to five possibilities.
column5: Visit a player to investigate them, narrowing down their role to five possibilities.

column4: Visit two players. You learn whether they are the same alignment. // You may not visit the same player twice.
column5: Visit two players. You learn whether they are the same alignment. // You may not visit the same player twice.

column4: Visit a player. You learn the identities of anyone visiting them for the first time.
column5: Visit a player. You learn the identities of anyone visiting them for the first time.

column4: Visit a player with the intent of investigating them, although you immediately forget what you have learned. // Anyone who visits you is also lost to your memory. // Once per game, you may spend a night recalling the roles you have forgotten (but not the corresponding players). *Each role is only listed once, even if it is in your memory multiple times.
column5: Visit a player with the intent of investigating them, although you immediately forget what you have learned. // Anyone who visits you is also lost to your memory. // Once per game, you may spend a night recalling the roles you have forgotten (but not the corresponding players). *Each role is only listed once, even if it is in your memory multiple times.

column4: Visit three players. If they are all of different alignments, you learn each of their roles; otherwise, you learn nothing.
column5: Visit three players. If they are all of different alignments, you learn each of their roles; otherwise, you learn nothing.

column4: Choose any dead player. You learn their night results from the phase they died.
column5: Choose any dead player. You learn their night results from the phase they died.

column4: Thrice per game, you may learn either the role names OR identities (your choice) of everyone who visits you.
column5: Thrice per game, you may learn either the role names OR identities (your choice) of everyone who visits you.

column4: Choose any set of 4 living players. You learn whether the group consists of more boys, more girls, or an even split.
column5: Choose any set of 4 living players. You learn whether the group consists of more boys, more girls, or an even split.

column4: Each night, you learn the names of any other players visited by the Mafia that cycle. *If someone is visited multiple times, they only show up once. // You cannot speak in night chats (though you may be added to them).
column5: Each night, you learn the names of any other players visited by the Mafia that cycle. *If someone is visited multiple times, they only show up once. // You cannot speak in night chats (though you may be added to them).

column4: Visit a player to learn the archetype of their role (but not their alignment). *Archetypes are combined as ...
column5: Visit a player to learn the archetype of their role (but not their alignment). *Archetypes are combined as ...

column4: Check a player's alignment. // The alignment you learn will be wrong. *(It will be randomly selected from the two incorrect alignments.)
column5: Check a player's alignment. // The alignment you learn will be wrong. *(It will be randomly selected from the two incorrect alignments.)

column4: Visit a player to protect them. // If they are attacked directly, you will take the attack on their behalf, and deal an attack to their attacker.
column5: Visit a player to protect them. // If they are attacked directly, you will take the attack on their behalf, and deal an attack to their attacker.

column4: Visit a player to protect them from attacks. // The first time you are attacked, you automatically choose to protect yourself instead.
column5: Visit a player to protect them from attacks. // The first time you are attacked, you automatically choose to protect yourself instead.

column4: Coat someone in protective jelly, saving them from the next standard attack they incur. // Jelly lasts indefinitely until attacked, but you may only have jelly on two people at a time. // During the day, remove jelly from a player.
column5: Coat someone in protective jelly, saving them from the next standard attack they incur. // Jelly lasts indefinitely until attacked, but you may only have jelly on two people at a time. // During the day, remove jelly from a player.

column4: Visit a player to brighten their spirits, shielding them from evil energy. Any actions by non-town players (aside from attacks) will be unable to affect them.
column5: Visit a player to brighten their spirits, shielding them from evil energy. Any actions by non-town players (aside from attacks) will be unable to affect them.

column4: Once during the game, you may protect yourself and deal a standard attack to everyone who visits you. This action cannot be roleblocked. // For each player you attack, you gain a charge of the above ability.
column5: Once during the game, you may protect yourself and deal a standard attack to everyone who visits you. This action cannot be roleblocked. // For each player you attack, you gain a charge of the above ability.

column4: Visit a player to scare them, dealing a standard attack. // If you kill a town member you will die immediately.
column5: Visit a player to scare them, dealing a standard attack. // If you kill a town member you will die immediately.

column4: Twice per game, you may hop into someone's pocket during the day. They will feel you in there. // At the end of the night, they are dealt a Strong attack.
column5: Twice per game, you may hop into someone's pocket during the day. They will feel you in there. // At the end of the night, they are dealt a Strong attack.

column4: Visit a player and guess their rolename. If you are correct, you will turn them upside-down, dealing them a standard attack. If they die, their role will not be revealed.
column5: Visit a player and guess their rolename. If you are correct, you will turn them upside-down, dealing them a standard attack. If they die, their role will not be revealed.

column4: Twice during the game, you may choose to become untargetable. All actions on you will fail. // You learn the results you would have received that night.
column5: Twice during the game, you may choose to become untargetable. All actions on you will fail. // You learn the results you would have received that night.

column4: If you do not cast a vote during the day, your vote power is carried over to the following day. This can be stacked indefinitely. // If you are lynched, any Mafia who voted for you loses their ability for the night.
column5: If you do not cast a vote during the day, your vote power is carried over to the following day. This can be stacked indefinitely. // If you are lynched, any Mafia who voted for you loses their ability for the night.

column4: Check a player's alignment. // Protect a player. // Attack a player. // Invite a player to a night chat. // You may only use each ability once.
column5: Check a player's alignment. // Protect a player. // Attack a player. // Invite a player to a night chat. // You may only use each ability once.

column4: Thrice per game, visit a player to help them out during the day. That night, they may use a limited ability without charge, or an unlimited ability twice. // You may not help the same player twice.
column5: Thrice per game, visit a player to help them out during the day. That night, they may use a limited ability without charge, or an unlimited ability twice. // You may not help the same player twice.

column4: Visit a player to give them a hug, protecting them from attacks. // While being hugged, they are unable to use any actions.
column5: Visit a player to give them a hug, protecting them from attacks. // While being hugged, they are unable to use any actions.

column4: Visit a player to distract them, preventing them from taking any actions.
column5: Visit a player to distract them, preventing them from taking any actions.

column4: Visit a player to silently force them (and all their visitors) to target you instead.
column5: Visit a player to silently force them (and all their visitors) to target you instead.

column4: Visit two players and mix up their positions. // Visit two players and mix up their targets. // You may only use one action per night and may only target each player once.
column5: Visit two players and mix up their positions. // Visit two players and mix up their targets. // You may only use one action per night and may only target each player once.

column4: You can converse freely and openly with the dead during each night phase.
column5: You can converse freely and openly with the dead during each night phase.

column4: During the day, create a private chat for the night with any number of people. // The total size of all chats you have created (including you) may not exceed the player count.
column5: During the day, create a private chat for the night with any number of people. // The total size of all chats you have created (including you) may not exceed the player count.

column4: Send out invites to your party during the day! Everyone who votes for you joins your night chat. // If you are lynched, the party is cancelled.
column5: Send out invites to your party during the day! Everyone who votes for you joins your night chat. // If you are lynched, the party is cancelled.

column4: Post anything you want in announcements (it is clear it is from a player).
column5: Post anything you want in announcements (it is clear it is from a player).

column4: You may quietly perform the faction kill without visiting your target. You cannot be roleblocked or controlled.
column5: You may quietly perform the faction kill without visiting your target. You cannot be roleblocked or controlled.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Pop up outside your target's house, lying in wait for a specific player. If they visit your target, you deal a standard attack, but your name is revealed to any other visitors.
column5: Pop up outside your target's house, lying in wait for a specific player. If they visit your target, you deal a standard attack, but your name is revealed to any other visitors.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Spin up a protective shield around a player of your choice, protecting them from standard attacks.
column5: Spin up a protective shield around a player of your choice, protecting them from standard attacks.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Visit a player and use your big brain to deduce their role.
column5: Visit a player and use your big brain to deduce their role.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Each night you learn the names of all players in night chats. // Once per game, you may choose a chat to eavesdrop: you can read through it the next day.
column5: Each night you learn the names of all players in night chats. // Once per game, you may choose a chat to eavesdrop: you can read through it the next day.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Peer over someone's shoulder to watch where they go at night and learn which players visit them.
column5: Peer over someone's shoulder to watch where they go at night and learn which players visit them.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: You appear as town when investigated, and are immune to standard attacks. // You may not perform the faction kill. // Once per game, you may permanently take on any non-Killing Mafia role which is not in the game.
column5: You appear as town when investigated, and are immune to standard attacks. // You may not perform the faction kill. // Once per game, you may permanently take on any non-Killing Mafia role which is not in the game.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: During the day, create a private night chat with any number of people.
column5: During the day, create a private night chat with any number of people.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Mess up the path to someone's house. All Town members who try to visit them will slip and have their actions fail.
column5: Mess up the path to someone's house. All Town members who try to visit them will slip and have their actions fail.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Shout over someone, bullying them into keeping quiet for the following day. // You may not target the same player twice.
column5: Shout over someone, bullying them into keeping quiet for the following day. // You may not target the same player twice.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Once per cycle, tickle a player to prevent them from using actions that phase.
column5: Once per cycle, tickle a player to prevent them from using actions that phase.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Visit a player and give them a makeover, choosing the role they appear as when investigated and the player they appear to visit for the duration of the night. // This does not affect death announcements.
column5: Visit a player and give them a makeover, choosing the role they appear as when investigated and the player they appear to visit for the duration of the night. // This does not affect death announcements.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Visit a player and tell them a lie: overwrite, edit or augment their night results in any way you choose. // Post anything you want in announcements (it is clear it is from a player).
column5: Visit a player and tell them a lie: overwrite, edit or augment their night results in any way you choose. // Post anything you want in announcements (it is clear it is from a player).
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Three times per game, you may tidy up a player's belongings during the night. If they die that night, their role will not be revealed. // From the belongings learn their role.
column5: Three times per game, you may tidy up a player's belongings during the night. If they die that night, their role will not be revealed. // From the belongings learn their role.
column6: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Visit a player to tell them a joke each night.
column5: Visit a player to tell them a joke each night.
column6: Tell a joke to every living player.

column4: You are assigned a random Town member to guard. // Twice per game while alive, you may visit your ward and protect them.
column5: You are assigned a random Town member to guard. // Twice per game while alive, you may visit your ward and protect them.
column6: Keep them alive at least as long as any other town member.

column4: Visit a player to learn their role. // Guess the role of every living player. You die upon making a guess, whether it is correct or incorrect.
column5: Visit a player to learn their role. // Guess the role of every living player. You die upon making a guess, whether it is correct or incorrect.

column4: You must survive to the end of the game. // You cannot be targeted or investigated: anyone attempting to do so will have their action fail.
column5: You must survive to the end of the game. // You cannot be targeted or investigated: anyone attempting to do so will have their action fail.
column6: Survive to the end of the game.

column4: Choose a player and boss them around, controlling their night action or roleblocking them. They will know if they have been controlled. You also learn their role.
column5: Choose a player and boss them around, controlling their night action or roleblocking them. They will know if they have been controlled. You also learn their role.

column4: When you are lynched, everyone who voted for you is unable to use any actions the following night. // You may visit a player each phase and act generally naughty.
column5: When you are lynched, everyone who voted for you is unable to use any actions the following night. // You may visit a player each phase and act generally naughty.

column4: During the day, nullify the vote of one other player of your choice. // You may also choose to submit a private vote to override your public vote. // During the night, visit a player. If they are lynched the following day (and a member of the town) you win the game.
column5: During the day, nullify the vote of one other player of your choice. // You may also choose to submit a private vote to override your public vote. // During the night, visit a player. If they are lynched the following day (and a member of the town) you win the game.
column6: Choose a Town member and get them lynched.

column4: You may deal a standard attack from Night 2 onwards. // With each kill, you gain defence, then a Strong attack, then a permanent disguise, then roleblock/control/redirect immunity, then a standard attack during the day.
column5: You may deal a standard attack from Night 2 onwards. // With each kill, you gain defence, then a Strong attack, then a permanent disguise, then roleblock/control/redirect immunity, then a standard attack during the day.
column6: Kill every Town and Mafia member.

column4: You begin the game sick and with resistance to standard attacks; anyone who visits you also becomes sick. // Visit a player nightly to infect them and all their visitors. Learn the list of sick players. // When everyone alive is sick, it is announced that you are unkillable at night and may choose someone to die of sickness nightly.
column5: You begin the game sick and with resistance to standard attacks; anyone who visits you also becomes sick. // Visit a player nightly to infect them and all their visitors. Learn the list of sick players. // When everyone alive is sick, it is announced that you are unkillable at night and may choose someone to die of sickness nightly.
column6: Kill every Town and Mafia member.

column4: Deal a Strong attack to a player. // You are passively protected from attacks.
column5: Deal a Strong attack to a player. // You are passively protected from attacks.
column6: Kill every Town and Mafia member.

column4: You may freely deal a standard attack to a player (without visiting them). // At night, visit another player to disguise yourself as their role. During the day, cast a second vote in private. The first time you would die, you instead lose this ability.
column5: You may freely deal a standard attack to a player (without visiting them). // At night, visit another player to disguise yourself as their role. During the day, cast a second vote in private. The first time you would die, you instead lose this ability.
column6: Kill every Town and Mafia member.
